page.title: 06SHAFTS AND QUARRIES
page.content: There are three limestone quarries and four shafts in the area we surveyed. All of them disused.There are two quarries in Lyme Park.One is just inside West Parkgate and the other is on the edge of the park about a kilometre to the North East.The first is a scenic place with a stream and woodland.The second one is just a pile of rubble.The third and last quarry is North West of Hilltop Farm and is on farmland.There is some evidence of shafts,such as unnatural bumps and dips in the ground,especially in a flat field.At a particular shaft there is a dip in the ground although it is filled in.A hundred metres away the ground has subsided.This is the case at all the shafts.Men are working to clear a slag heap from local coalmines
